page.title: 09South Duffield - transport
page.content: Some of the parents in South Duffield are threatening to keep their children away from school because the County Council will not provide{free school transport.}When the school closed the East Riding county Council promised to provide free transport to the school at Hemingbrough. Now North Yorkshire County Council says that as the distance is less than two miles the children are not entitled to free transport and will have to pay. Parents say they cannot afford to pay, and the route the children, aged between 4 and 10, have to walk is very dangerous. There is a deep dyke along part of the road, and children have to cross an unmanned railway crossing, and the busy A63 road.
